ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Meets criteria for Bipolar Disorder, Type I or II
Age at onset of first MDE (major depressive episode)
Age at first treatment of depression
Number of lifetime depressed episodes
age at first manic episode
Age at first treatment of manic episode
Manic and Hypomania Total Number of Manic Episodes
Hospitalization for depressive episode
Psych History Number of hospitalizations for depressive episodes
Hospitalization for manic episode
Psych History Number of hospitalizations for manic episodes
Current episode is depression
Start date of current depressive episode
Major Depressive Episode, Current Episode, Duration (weeks)
Number of current BD medications subject did not respond to
Suicide attempt
Number of Lifetime Suicide Attempts
Number of suicide attempts month
Alcohol Use - Status
Alcohol Use - Frequency
Alcohol Use - Amount (drinks/week)
Nicotine Use - Status
Nicotine Use - Frequency
Nicotine Use - Amount (packs/week)
Condition/Abnormality/Procedure 1
migraine headaches
Elevated Blood Pressure at the visit: systolic blood pressure >= 130 mmHg or diastolic blood pressure >= 85 mmHg
Diabetes Mellitus
Notes: 0 = No current diabetes or random BS < 220;1 = Diagnosis of diabetes or random BS >220

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Central obesity (ethnicity-specific waist circumference)
BMI >= 30
Raised triglycerides (greater than 1.7 mmol/L for males,  greater than 1.29 mmol/L for females, or treatment for lipid abnormality)
Reduced HDL (<1.03 mmol/L for males, <1.29 mmol/L for females, or treatment for lipid abnormality)
Meet obesity (WC or BMI) plus trig/hdl/bp criterion item
Inflammatory bowel disease (ulcerative colitis, Crohn's disease)
Rheumatological disorders (rheumatoid arthritis); psoriasis
Smoking cigarettes (daily - minimum half a pack)
C-reactive protein greater than or equal to 5 mg/L
Total number of inflammatory criteria met DOES NOT INCL MIGRAINE
Condition/Abnormality/Procedures - Total number of items mentioned in v1_MH_CAP
